conclusion: Use the formula for magnetic force on a current-carrying conductor: F = I L B sin(θ).
The wire is bent into a V-shape with an included angle of 60° and the magnetic field is perpendicular to the plane of the wire, so θ = 90°.
The V-shaped wire forms two segments of length l each with an angle of 60° between them.
Calculate the force on each segment: F_i = I l B sin(90°) = I l B.
Resolve the forces into components perpendicular and parallel to the axis of symmetry of the V-shape.
The perpendicular component of each force is F_⊥ = I l B sin(30°) = 1/2 I l B.
Add the perpendicular components: F_total = 2 * (1/2 I l B) = I l B.
The magnitude of the Ampere force received by the V-shaped current-carrying wire is I l B.
